name: df-ibl
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3
body: |- wceq(cibl, crab(s0, cmbf, wral(s1, co(nat0, cfz, nat3), wcel(cfv(citg2, cmpt(s2, cr, csb(s3, cfv(cre, co(cfv(cv(s0), cv(s2)), cdiv, co(ci, cexp, cv(s1)))), cif(cv(s3), nat0, wa(wcel(cv(s2), cdm(cv(s0))), wbr(nat0, cle, cv(s3))))))), cr))))
comment: Define the class of integrable functions on the reals. A function is integrable if it is measurable and the integrals of the pieces of the function are all finite. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 28-Jun-2014.)
